body_html:
@peterjc123
Hi, under torch\utils\ffi, the ffi module (init.py) is fully support windows ? As i found there is a .so extension at line 99 (torch\utils\ffi\ init.py) while compiling pytorch-faster-rcnn [ https://github.com/ruotianluo/pytorch-faster-rcnn ]. I have the following error. I have installed cffi via anaconda package. Is it relate to the .so extension?

Thank you
body:
@peterjc123 
Hi, under torch\utils\ffi, the ffi module (__init__.py) is fully support windows ? As i found there is a .so extension at line 99 (torch\utils\ffi\ __init__.py) while compiling pytorch-faster-rcnn [ https://github.com/ruotianluo/pytorch-faster-rcnn ].  I have the following error. I have installed cffi via anaconda package. Is it relate to the .so extension? 
![ffi](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30174905/31776209-7914bca4-b51d-11e7-974d-7212cf5a4fe8.PNG)
Thank you
